text:
CHUCK SCHUMER: Judge Gorsuch may
act like a neutral, calm judge.

But his record and
his career clearly

show he harbors a right-wing,
pro-corporate special
interest agenda.

He enacted it time and time
again on the Tenth Circuit.

And if given the
chance, I have no doubt

he would do it again
in the Supreme Court.

He expresses a lot of
empathy and sympathy
for the less powerful.

But when it comes time to
rule, when the chips are down,

far too often he sides
with the powerful few

over everyday Americans trying
to just get a fair shake.

We've seen this play
out time and time again.

Judge Gorsuch repeatedly
sided with insurance

companies that wanted
to deny disability
benefits to employees.

In employment
discrimination cases,

"Bloomberg" found he sided
with employers 60% of the time.

In one of the few cases
he sided with an employee,

it was a Republican
who alleged she was
fired for being a conservative.

A hard-right
conservative billionaire

groomed and nurtured Judge
Gorsuch for the Tenth Circuit
and now the Supreme Court.

That is a cause for alarm for
every working-class American

and should give senators
pause about putting him on
the highest court of the land.
